text: Describe a strategy for finding the change in temperature when you are given a beginning and ending temperature. How can you represent this difference on a number line?

At this time, student should have informal methods for adding and subtracting integers using real world contexts and number lines.

Students might:

  • Recognize the location of opposites on a number line with respect to zero.
  • Begin to notice a connection between addition and subtraction with positive and negative numbers.
  • Begin to see the change in temperature as a variable amount of change on a number line.
  • See the change in temperature as an addend in an equation.
